frame.name: Simple_naming
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> conventionally uses a particular <fen>Term</fen> to refer to an <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>The pattern of conservation is similar to that found in C1_1, therefore <fex name="spe">we</fex> have <t>termed</t> <fex name="ent">this domain</fex> <fex name="Term">DC1</fex> for divergent C1 domain.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that is conventionally referred to by a <fen>Term</fen>.
<ex>Because of that shift, physicists <t>call</t> <fex name="ent">this effect</fex> the "gravitational red shift."</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Term
FE.definition:
<def-root>The linguistic sign that is used for referring to a type of <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>The French <t>term</t> this plant <fex name="ter">Petit ChÃªne</fex>, from the shape of the leaves.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>The speaker or speech community that uses a <fen>Term</fen> to refer to a particular <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="spe">Mathematicians</fex> <t>call</t> this subject "arithmetic," reserving the word "algebra" for the more advanced aspects of the subject.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A reason for why the <fen>Term</fen> used for the <fen>Entity</fen> is the one chosen.
<ex>They <t>call</t> their chip the C-Most <fex name="mot">because it is a CMOS chip</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Term</fen> referring to the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: term.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: call by a specified term
